page.title: 04Mr Dickens-Fishing Bailiff
page.content: Mr Dickens is the fishing bailiff for the lakes just to the south of Mollands Lane.A bailiff is someone who walks around the lakes, checking the permits and licences of people who are fishing there.He also ensures that stocks of fish are up to required standards.Mr Dickens works for South Essex Carp Fisheries.There are six lakes in the area altogether. In the lakes there are fish weighing up to 30lbs such as carp,pike and trout.When we visited the lakes,we saw three pairs of Great Crested Grebes.One Grebe was diving under water, searching for fish.It stayed under for about twenty seconds,then it resurfaced in a different part of the lake. By Alan Sadgrove.
